data.title: Make Alt-F behaviour native on Windows
data.body:
Make Alt-F work natively - to open file menu - as per standard behaviour on Windows platform.

Refer issue #474

data.title: Feature Request : `atom-text-editor` Make it simple DOM innerHTML friendly
data.body:
The markdown preview editor needs to do some fancy stuff to embed a read only text editor : https://github.com/atom/markdown-preview/blob/2bcbadac3980f1aeb455f7078bd1fdfb4e6fe6b1/lib/renderer.coffee#L101-L125

Ideally one should be able to do: 

``` js
div.innerHTML = "<atom-text-editor gutter-hidden data-grammar="source ts">var someCode = 123;</atom-text-editor>
```

And it should just render a read only text editor. 
# Motivation

I would like to use the `atom-text-editor` in a bunch of places and as a sample I've managed to add it to the `find references view` : https://github.com/TypeStrong/atom-typescript/issues/407#issuecomment-115488965 but it took way too much code https://github.com/TypeStrong/atom-typescript/commit/f0616fab016fa330294e39f897a0c8ed9c1acbc9

PS: please let me know if I missed something :rose:

data.title: Clicking URLs in Package and Theme views cause unresponsiveness
data.body:
Clicking URLs in the Package and Theme views such as Package/Theme names and authors causes the main WebView to go unresponsive. No exception is thrown that the Developer Tool can catch and pausing has no effect, so it's probably at a deeper level. Currently trying to step through and find the exact code that causes the crash.

**Atom Version:** 1.0.0 built from commit 3874576
**System:** Arch Linux

data.title: Atom not launching
data.body:
i tried uninstalling and installing again but its not launching again.
There is no error message shown , i tried to launch it through cmd as well but its still not launching

data.title: cmd+n should default to cmd+shift+n when no windows are open on OS X
data.body:
Atom: 1.0
Mac OS X: 10.10.3

On OS X, if you close all windows so only the menubar is active, cmd+n does nothing at all. It should default to cmd+shift+n if no windows are open in Atom.app.

Apple mention suggestions for default keys here: http://support.apple.com/kb/HT1343

data.title: Updating Linux.md
data.body: Adding some techniques for installing Atom that have worked for me on 32 bit Linux distros. All the techniques on this page that I've been able to try on 32-bit systems, at least, have failed, hence why I am proposing these changes.

data.title: Fix Arch build instructions
data.body: PYTHON environment variable needs to be in all caps

data.title: UI Scaling for High DPI Displays?
data.body:
Here's what atom looks like on my Chromebook Pixel (2015) - running trusty Ubuntu / Gnome. 
It has a DPI of 239.
![screenshot from 2015-06-25 18 48 39](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6345012/8367395/80fe2052-1b6b-11e5-8f7a-8263ee72b7d8.png)

Is there any way to fix this via internal settings?

data.title: Windows 7 - No any git related color highlighting, diff info
data.body:
Seems like every git related functions of Atom not working for me. I used the official windows installer, but in the past I used the zip package, still the same. git is in my PATH, just like apm and atom.

For the records I'm in an actual .git repo and editing a file when this happens (or more accurate: not happening anything).

data.title: Markdown preview doesn't have a scrollbar
data.body:
On my Mac, a sample Markdown file that's more than one page:

![screen shot 2015-06-25 at 3 17 14 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/474/8366825/51ba21ec-1b4d-11e5-9141-a5163d34e32b.png)
![screen shot 2015-06-25 at 3 17 16 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/474/8366824/51b8b0c8-1b4d-11e5-814a-17dffe705cc5.png)

Doesn't render with a scrollbar in the preview.

![screen shot 2015-06-25 at 3 17 22 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/474/8366822/519f079a-1b4d-11e5-921d-440b67d83706.png)
![screen shot 2015-06-25 at 3 17 21 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/474/8366823/51b8c3e2-1b4d-11e5-9ab3-33e4785f6a0a.png)

A tiny movie: https://cloudup.com/cHaasRuYJoX

Versions:
- **Atom:**       1.0.0
- **Atom-Shell:** 0.22.3
- **OS:**         Mac OS X 10.10.3

data.title: Markdown syntax highlighter doesn't ignore code block's asterisks
data.body:
Markdown parser reads italics from "*" in code blocks but shouldn't.

My Markdown READMEs are mostly italicized these days:

![](https://cloudup.com/files/iWKHthnh4-w/download)

Even though this is a code block (indented by a tab or four spaces), the in-file syntax highlighter doesn't know it.
## Repro Steps
1. Put some code with a "*" in a markdown file. Here's some simple Markdown for you:

```
Hello everyone! Here's some code:

    NSString *title = [NSString stringWithString:@"Hi"];

Anyways, hope your text looks normal!
```
1. Open this in Atom.
## Versions
- **Atom:**       1.0.0
- **Atom-Shell:** 0.22.3
- **OS:**         Mac OS X 10.10.3

---

<small>This report was created in and posted from the Atom editor using the package `bug-report` v0.7.1.</small>

data.title: language-maude package: deprecation
data.body:
The package language-maude is deprecated and the author haven't updated the repo since a year ago. It's possible correct the problem ou say what is needed to correct it?

The log:

```
Store package settings files in the settings/ directory instead of scoped-properties/
```

```
/Users/alex/.atom/packages/linter-eslint/lib/linter-eslint.coffee:137 Cannot read property 'match' of undefined

  at TokenizedBuffer.module.exports.TokenizedBuffer.indentLevelForLine (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/tokenized-buffer.js:647:23)
  at DisplayBuffer.module.exports.DisplayBuffer.indentLevelForLine (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/display-buffer.js:818:35)
  at TextEditor.module.exports.TextEditor.indentLevelForLine (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/text-editor.js:2220:33)
  at TextEditor.module.exports.TextEditor.indentationForBufferRow (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/text-editor.js:2192:19)
  at /Users/alex/.atom/packages/linter-eslint/lib/linter-eslint.coffee:108:44
```

data.title: Updates failing in Atom 1.0
data.body:
Just updated to Atom 1.0 and it tells me there are updates but it errors out when checking for updates. Here is a screenshot:

![atom-1 0-updates-failing](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/190154/8360648/0d126b00-1b3c-11e5-973f-22dd459a4470.png)

data.title: Searching packages aways fails
data.body:
Getting really wound up by the latest update. 
Appears it just HANGS are various points like when trying to search for a package. Install, Select a option
You have no idea if its accepted your response or just frozen. 

Its taken over 30 attempts to load the packages to install 1 package.... Really. 

Thinking of going back to PHPEd after this, seriously messed up my day!!
This may be a irrelivent Issue to track, But i wanted to provide my feedback to why i am now leaving Atom. 

Its not ideal for someone trying to do alot of work under tight deadlines.

data.title: Mini editor with TextEditor::setMini
data.body:
`TextEditor` has a function called `setMini` that toggles the mini state of an editor. The problem is that it only "changes" the `TextEditor` itself and `TextEditorPresenter`, but not `TextEditorElement`.
Before fix:
![unfixed-setmini](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7817714/8353884/1fbc8b9e-1b43-11e5-965a-8e420f80ab94.png)
After fix:
![fixed-setmini](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7817714/8353886/2774bd7a-1b43-11e5-8c85-a38d264e470f.png)
Code:

``` coffeescript
@content: ->
    ...
    @div class:'editor-item', =>
            @subview 'test_data', new TextEditorView({mini:true, placeholderText:'Test Input'})
    ...

toggleMini: ->
    editor = @test_data.getModel()
    editor.setMini(not editor.isMini())
```

data.title: Feature request: Auto updating atom in Linux
data.body:
Can auto update in atom (from within atom) on linux, please be worked upon?

If possible it should have delta updates.

data.title: Uncaught Error: EISDIR: illegal operation on a directory, read

data.title: feature request: Tree View: 'search' a file by typing
data.body:
When a folder has a lot of files, more than fits on the screen vertically, I would like to 'focus' a specific file by typing the first letters of the file.
I notice 'A' and 'D' are already mapped by default to _add_ and _duplicate_, so I propse to add 'F' (or 'S') for _find_ (or _search_) to use following keyboard input for finding a matching file and focusing it, bringing it into view if it's off screen.
A comparative user experience is in Windows Explorer, also when done there on the folder tree-view, if I remember correctly, the search is done over all currently visible nodes of the tree.

Brenton
